history.content: Revise probability (from CS70) and linear algebra (from Math 54/EE16A) over winter break and take EE127 and CS189 together next semester (along with 161, if you wish). It will be hard and I know this is not the ideal path suggested by others, but you will make it :)

Revise probability (from CS70) and linear algebra (from Math 54/EE16A) over winter break and take EE127 and CS189 together next semester (along with 161, if you wish). It will be hard but you will make it :)
Revise probability and linear algebra over winter break and take 127 and 189 together next semester (along with 161, if you wish). It will be hard but you will make it :)

children.subject: 127 is easily one of the most useful, interesting, and enjoyable courses I've taken at Cal. I highly recommend taking it (especially if you're considering research).

history.content:
Hi, I would love some advice here.

So I am going into my last semester at Berkeley, and I actually got into the CS program fairly late because I wasn't sure what I wanted to do my first 2 years, I declared as a Junior. And now I am running out of time to take all the classes I feel like I need to take to lay the foundation for my interests.

I think I have enough of a foundation in software engineering with CS170, CS162, CS168, and planning on taking CS161 next semester and I believe I will be able to learn a lot on the job that I have lined up. 

That being said, I now have an interest in getting more into Machine Learning, AI and Data Science and going to grad school in the future for Stats or CS.

I wanted to take CS189 next semester (I have taken CS188, Math 54, Math 53, EE16A), but I have been reading that EECS 126 and EECS127 are very very important, and I think Professor Sahai even said that having those under your belt, you can self-study 189.

So would it be more beneficial for my future if I took 126 and 127 instead of 189 next semester? 

Finally, I am also planning on taking the Game Design/Development Decal which I heard can take up quite a bit of time as well. If I end up having to pick just one between EE126 and EE127 , which one do you guys think will be better?

(I really do not wish to overload my schedule with too much coursework as I do want to spend some meaningful time in the non-academic/career-focused aspects of life that we tend to neglect in my last semester of college. hopefully it doesn't come to this but I am not sure what the work load for these classes are like so any input here would be very helpful too!)

Sorry for the very long message and thank you for any input/advice anyone can provide me! I really appreciate it!!!
history.subject: Last semester, what class should I prioritize?
